it.cnr.isti.thematrix.scripting.sys

Class TheMatrixSys

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.cnr.isti.thematrix.scripting.sys.TheMatrixSys

  • public class TheMatrixSys
extends java.lang.Object
    Main class of the TheMatrix interpreter, holding the common definitions and objects needed by the interpreter. The class mostly behaves like a singleton (with static fields and methods) except when a new interpreters has to be recursively activated (due to a subscript being called from the current script). In this case, the class will push a copy of itself on its own internal stack structure, and create a fresh copy for the sake of executing the subscript. TODO refactor initialization stuff to a new TheMatrixSysDefinitions package (temporary schemas) TODO refactor methods that access the moduleTable to belong to the ModuleTable class? (thus removing the need to have them all static...) TODO (memento) check here http://www.basilv.com/psd/blog/2012/visualizing-java-package-dependencies
    Author:
    edoardovacchi, massimo

      • paramTable

        protected SymbolTable paramTable
        a table of symbol instances. This is a map that contains all and only the elements in paramList

      • paramList

        protected java.util.List<Symbol<?>> paramList
        a list of Symbol instances that represents the typed values that a script expects, as defined in its MatrixParameters. The Symbol instances shall occur in the order that the MatrixParameters instance specify them. For instance, if ParametersModule defines two parameters: [{ SOMEINT: int}; {SOMESTRING: string}] then this list should contain, in the same order, the values for those parameter definitions, e.g.: List(new Symbol(15, Type.INT), new Symbol("hello world", Type.STRING)) where "15" is some arbitrary number and "hello world" is some arbitrary string. This is generally useful when the paramList is synthesized, e.g., it is being passed from an outer interpreter (if the script being executed is nested), or for testing purposes. The MatrixParameters instance iterates over this list and checks whether the argument *types* match. Names are not required to match. Cf. paramList

      • moduleTable

        protected ModuleTable moduleTable

      • currentModule

        protected java.lang.String currentModule

      • argList

        protected java.util.List<java.lang.String> argList
        The list of string arguments that are (or may be) read from the CLI. The String arguments will be processed by the first (and only) MatrixParameters instance. Cf. paramList The string arguments shall occur in the order that the MatrixParameters instance specify them. For instance, if ParametersModule defines two parameters: { SOMEINT: int}; {SOMESTRING: string}] then this list should contain, in the same order, the values for those parameter definitions, e.g.: List("15", "hello world") where "15" is some arbitrary number and "hello world" is some arbitrary string.

      • listOM

        private static java.util.List<MatrixFileOutput> listOM
        The list of output modules to be taken care of for the current script. Will contain at least one module (which may or may not be an output module, see defaultOutput. TODO in order to correctly support multiple FileOutput modules in nested scripts maybe this will need to be a protected field, allowing it to be reset / dealt with separately at the boundary of the two instances of the interpreter

      • listOMPostExecution

        private static java.util.List<MatrixFileOutput> listOMPostExecution
        Second list of FileOutputModules (see listOM) which is only used after the script execution; see also performGraphPostProcessing(). We don't pull from FileOutputMs that have consumers during script execution (data loss would result). However, since we cannot be sure that all the output is extracted by the other stages (this depends on the semantic of the program, so data-dependent) at end of script we pull any remaining data from those modules, which are recorded in this list.

      • defaultOutput

        private static boolean defaultOutput
        true if and only if the script does contain no output modules, it activates the debug-time behaviour of extracting the output from the last module in the script chain returned by getCurrentModule() TODO in order to correctly support multiple FileOutput modules in nested scripts maybe this will need to be a protected field, allowing it to be reset / dealt with separately at the boundary of the two instances of the interpreter

      • addModule

        public static void addModule(MatrixModule m)
        ModuleTable.put() used by the parser and by this class to add new modules, checking for duplicates. In case of duplicate name we raise an exception to be caught later on (outside of the eval() ). TODO This is currently done extending RuntimeException, as the Neverlang-generated code does not have matching throws declarations.
        Parameters:
        m -

      • substituteModule

        public static void substituteModule(MatrixModule m)
        ModuleTable.put() used by this class and by module implementations to substitute modules which already exist. It checks that a module with the same name exists; if there is none, we raise an exception to be caught later on (outside of the eval() ). FIXME probably not needed, the one with a name specified is actually called TODO This is currently done extending RuntimeException, as the Neverlang-generated code does not have matching throws declarations.
        Parameters:
        m -

      • substituteModule

        public static void substituteModule(java.lang.String name,
                    MatrixModule m)
        Module table put used by the parser when processing MatrixScriptInput Modules; it checks that a module with the same name actually exists. Note that the module name in the lookup table is the one specified in this call, which is NOT necessarily the same one the module has in the referenced script. In case the module is not found we raise an exception to be caught later on (outside of the eval() ). TODO This is currently done extending RuntimeException, as the Neverlang-generated code does not have matching throws declarations.
        Parameters:
        name -
        m -

      • internalMain

        private static boolean internalMain(java.lang.String[] args)
        Largest part of the main() of this class, used to initialize tons of data without running the script eval(); written in order to be called from a static bloc, or possibly from a separate class. Returns a boolean: if false, it means we should not continue normal execution due to non recoverable error.
        Parameters:

        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        This is the main called at program startup, taking care of all initializations and of script execution. Delegates part of the work to reusable auxiliary methods, which are typically static and return a boolean result.
        Parameters:
        args - ordinary meaning
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • pullOutput

        private static void pullOutput()
        Deal with pulling output from all active output modules in the script. Uses the two listOM* variables generated by postprocessing. Takes care of terminal modules first, getting batches of rows from each output; round robin schedule among the non-empty ones. It then drains out non terminal pending modules if any, each one all of the remaining output .

      • performModuleGraphPostProcessing

        private static boolean performModuleGraphPostProcessing(java.lang.String fileName)
        Performs various kind of postprocessing operations on the graph of modules contained in the moduleTable, inserting/deleting modules to support specific language features without the user knowing it or stating explicitly. Returns a boolean: if false, it means we should not continue normal execution due to non recoverable error. Affects the object state and returns values by modifying important instance variables besides the moduleTable: see listOM, defaultOutput Currently supports the following postprocessing operations:
        1) add BufferModules wherever multiple module read from a same source module
        2) find the output modules defined at the outer level of scripting
        3) find the sort modules which actually read from a temporary file and shortcut them to avoid the extra copy
        4) explicitly create at least an output module, if they are missing
        Note: daisy-chained buffer should work, but should not be used. We do not check atm. Besides, see within the comments the design of a mechanism for additional modules to postprocess DBMS downloaded data.
        Returns:
        false means the method has failed some way, true means continue execution.

      • printConsumerGraph

        private static void printConsumerGraph(java.lang.String graphName,
                      char phase)
        Utility function to print the whole module graph, nodes and edges. Output suitable as a DOT language file for Graphviz output. It scans the whole inputTable looking at the consumers arrays (not all modules have an accessible input module or a single input). Can save to a file,
        Parameters:
        graphName - the graph name inside the dot file, use valid characters for a DOT identifier
        phase - the phase identifier of this save; it is inserted in the file name, so use a valid character

      • cleanUpName

        private static java.lang.String cleanUpName(java.lang.String s)
        Clean up node names for DOT printing. Purges a module name from ASCII dots and other symbols embedded in it, also checks for a few substrings. Given syntax and file conventions, it is likely but there is unfortunately no guarantee that the node names will end up being unique.
        Returns:

      • closeGraphFile

        private static void closeGraphFile()

      • getUserOutputModules

        public static java.util.List<MatrixFileOutput> getUserOutputModules(boolean terminal)
        Find the output modules at the level of scripting managed by this instance of TheMatrixSys; this function only returns the output modules added to the script by the user, distinguishing the terminal ones from those which have a following module reading their output. The method ignores modules added by postprocessing (e.g. to-disk buffers). The list is used to pull the output at script execution time, and to connect the FileOutputs of nested scripts.
        Parameters:
        terminal - true if we want terminal nodes (nothing pulling their output); false if we want modules which already have consumers.
        Returns:
        List of output modules

      • getUserOutputModules

        public static java.util.List<MatrixFileOutput> getUserOutputModules()
        Find the output modules at the level of scripting managed by this instance of TheMatrixSys; this method returns all output modules added to the script by the user, but ignores modules added by postprocessing (e.g. to-disk buffers).
        Returns:
        List of output modules

      • getInfo

        private static java.lang.String getInfo(neverlang.runtime.dexter.ASTNode n)
        Method to extract detailed script location information concerning a parsing problem from an an ASTNode object of the Neverlang interpreter. The parameter is allowed to be null or invalid (there are cases where the interpreter cannot detect the ASTNode at fault) and any exception within this method is mapped to a default message.
        Parameters:
        n - the node where the interpreter parser encountered the problem, or null
        Returns:
        a message explaining either where the error happened, or that information is not available

      • readCommandLine

        private static void readCommandLine(java.lang.String[] args)
        Function to parse command-line arguments with jopts-simple. Process command-line parameters (forwarded by main()). Inserts information in the Dynamic singleton. Throw an error, and do not return at all if any arguments are malformed. Call usage() as appropriate, possibly with exit(0) on --help.
        --configPath absolute path to the main configuration file; UNIMPLEMENTED
        --help describe usage
        --scriptPath custom set the path for script execution, relative path to the main TheMatrix directory
        --iadPath custom set the path for the IAD files, relative path to the main TheMatrix directory
        --resultPath custom set the path for the result files, relative path to the main TheMatrix directory
        --loglevel sets the default log level to a value between 0 (minimum verbosity) and 3 (maximum)
        --dry-run do not compute; do not call the actual compute(), only perform the setup() of modules; passed to nested interpreters. Note that this is a partial implementation: will skip pulling the output from the module chain in main(), but some modules (e.g. sort) and nested scripts will still try to run. See main() for more information.
        --fullIADschema use the full IAD schema definition if parameter is not zero. Defaults to 0 during the alpha and beta test.
        --ignoreDBconnection disable DBMS access, will only generate the SQL queries and dump them as text files
        --dumpMappingSchema dump to System.out a template of the XML file for mapping the current schemata to a DBMS. Also enforces a --dry-run.
        --MappingTestRun perform the retrieval of all IAD files defined in the mapping.xml configuration UNIMPLEMENTED
        First unrecognized option is the file name of the script to execute. TODO Additional arguments after the script name are accepted but currently ignored (will become the script parameters).
        Parameters:
        args -

      • usage

      • eval

      • prepareSystem

        public static void prepareSystem()
        Method to initialize a number of symbol tables for script execution, called at system init time. Initialization is called within the static block of the class; adds definitions for default schemata, filtering operators, apply-able functions. All actual definitions are in specific methods in this class and in OperatorDefinitions . TODO move following comment to the proper method/class Schema definitions: IADperson, custom, IADhosp, IADoutpat, IADdrug, IADexe
        Operator definitions: equality for booleans, all comparison ops (6: > < >= <= = !=) for both types INT and DATE, equality for type STRING. These operators deal with missing values using the same semantic as STATA (to ease testing compatibility) where missing integers and dates are mapped to the highest/farthest future possible value. Note that since dates are compared using their representation in seconds, two dates in the same day can be different because of the time of the day.
        The semantics for missing boolean values is also the same as STATA; here missing values are read as true; in general, any int != 0 is a boolean true value (C style) -- to be handled in the csv parsing routine.
        TODO check with CSV reading that this is obeyed.
        TODO add string inequality operators; add more operators for boolean? TODO list the functions defined, possibly extend the function list.
        TODO add test unit to check the operators.

      • definePreliminaryIADSchemata

        static void definePreliminaryIADSchemata()
        Auxiliary function defining the first development version of IAD. The following schemata are NOT those from the agreed IAD definitions, they match the quasi-IAD schema of the test data provided by ARS; a few spurious fields are present and many IAD fields are still missing.
